post_text: September 19, 2016 at 6:43 PM#1Hi all,Is there a way, thru macro, to get a cue name ?Thank's and happy programming,

posts.post_text: September 19, 2016 at 6:43 PM#1Hi all,Is there a way, thru macro, to get a cue name ?Thank's and happy programming,

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: September 19, 2016 at 7:12 PM#2no, not with a macro.it can however be done with a Lua Plugin

posts.author: mybigmac
posts.post_text: September 19, 2016 at 9:06 PM#3Thank's that's help.I will not spend too much time looking for a solution that does not exist !

posts.author: sylvavio
posts.post_text: September 25, 2016 at 1:07 PM#4Hi,So I assume the answer is the same for a preset name ?

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: September 25, 2016 at 1:30 PM#5macros/commndline can only get data from $variablesso the answer is the same for everything, apart from what you see if you open a commandline feedback window and type LISTVAR.

title: Getting cue name
